Konstantin,
The exception needs to be fixed first so that the wizard can open. The next
question is whether the default version comparator should handle a version id
like this. My opinion is that the default comparator should use string
comparison as a backup, so that this id would still be handled, but using a
sub-optimal method. If you don't agree or there is some other way to handle this
then please pass the bug back to Gorkem (or create a new one) once the exception
is fixed.

Fixed the code to correctly catch this exception. The exception is still 
logged, but the wizard now does open.

I don't think I want to have two different default behaviors. I'd rather see 
this implemented as a custom version comparator, so over to you Gorkem.

adding Gerry and Justin so that yey can comment on the version number for OC4J.
Justin if I remember correct there was a plan to change the version supported in
WTP.

(In reply to comment #3)
> adding Gerry and Justin so that yey can comment on the version number for OC4J.
> Justin if I remember correct there was a plan to change the version supported in
> WTP. 

We are adding OC4J 10.1.3 and probably keep both DP4 and 10.1.3 for brief time.  The version number of 10.1.3 released version shall complaint to what is supported in WTP.  With the exception handled for dp4 and dp4 will be removed soon, we might or might not change the version number for dp4.
I am resolving this one since dp4 will be removed in the future.
